intro: Micromeria purtschelleri, commonly known as the desert sand verbena, is a small, flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or purple in color. It is well adapted to drought conditions, with a deep root system and a compact growth form. Micromeria purtschelleri plays a role in stabilizing desert soils and providing nectar for pollinators.
